page.title: 20Stone House Farm
page.content: Stone House Farm is situated in Hulme village.It is a traditional farmhouse, with farm buildings built around the courtyard.The farm covers about 100 acres of farm land.In the summer the animals are let out in the yard and fields.The animals include geese,ducks, calves,cows,bullocks,pigs,dogs and cats.A common disease that cattle get is called Forrest disease,which makes them have watery eyes. The farm is 300 years old.The crops grown are barley,oats,wheat,maize,hay and straw.In the winter they bring the younger calves in.When they are in the sheds they are fed on corn and hay.Then they are mucked out.The animals' food is stored in the loft above the pens. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Data compiled by pupils on Computer Studies Courses at Willfield High School,Bentilee,Stoke-On-Trent.
